intro: Gluta travancorica, commonly known as the Travancore gluta, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forests and shrublands. It has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
